page.title: 14Smarden W. - Marley Farm
page.content: Marley Farm is a classic example of change of use. Marley Farm house dates back to 1558 and doubtless the land has been farmed since before that date but now the land is leased out and the house flanked by light industrial units. In 1955 it was a cider factory but by 1962 it had changed to a large peanut packaging plant; this was a flourishing business until 1968 when the owner retired, business plummeted and various buildings were leased to other firms. There are now 7 separate concerns. A food processing and packaging plant, the largest, employs about 50 people; a frozen food store and warehouse 20; a cardboard carton manufacturer 16 and a plastic coatings firm 9. In smaller units a double glazing enterprise employs 6 and a joinery doing loft conversions 4.
